font-size: large;\"><b>MUTHAPPAN DEITY OF\nNORTH KERALA VADAKAYIL .</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When ever&nbsp; come back home on leave after a tenure on the\nship, the next morning my wife will make vellappam for breakfast. &nbsp;This dish requires yeast in the form of\nfermented coconut toddy.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fQQq7cWNKdk/UxAbc15KO6I/AAAAAAAApu8/QsRrfJtIjDk/s1600/inside-houseboat-kerala.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Toddy is mixed with\nrice dough and left over night to aid in fermentation and expansion of the\ndough causing the dough to rise overnight, making the bread soft when prepared.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vellappam is a &nbsp;round white lacy pancake with a crisp boundary\nwith an airy, soft on touch, fluffy center. It is doused in sweetened coconut\nmilk , or eaten with Kerala potato stew which uses coconut milk and pepper..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: small;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ngRZepmYg_4/UxAZGyeIfcI/AAAAAAAApuk/jc96fKmN-BM/s1600/dowfwrrhnbdnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ngRZepmYg_4/UxAZGyeIfcI/AAAAAAAApuk/jc96fKmN-BM/s1600/dowfwrrhnbdnload.jpg\" height=\"425\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today cocktail tattiquete\n\u2013 nay- etiquette requires that you know what \u201cAngostura bitters\u201d is. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you don\u2019t know the\nsnooty crowd will wrinkle their noses at you. This is almost like a Communist\nNOT knowing the word Bourgeouis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me tell you what it\nis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Malayalam Ayurveda call\nit SINJONA found in great abundance in the Western ghats . The British transplanted it in Ceylon .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a herb to prevent\ngas and farting . It was usual to put some of this herb along with some other carminative\nherbs/ spices for that flavor and feel good affect. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\">When you put Ayurvedic herb bitters it\nprevents fermentation of neera due to bacteria and inherent yeasts.</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bitters are also </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">cleansing, detoxifying, </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">germicidal, </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">parasiticidal, </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">stimulating, and tonifying.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; Mother Amba,\nYou reside in the three worlds and grant eternal bliss. You are the speech\n(Vani), You like the music and song played by the flute of Krishna (One with\nflower in hand), You are auspicious, Your face is like the reflection of the\nMoon, You killed Dhumraksha (a demon), You are eternal bliss, You are above\nall, You are the Goddess, and You rule the Lords as Rajarajeshvari||2||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mother Amba, You\npossess gems, stones and bracelet, You have a garland made of Keyura, Your neck\nis adorned with a wavy garland made of jasmine, perfumes and pearls, Your hands\nare adorned by veena (lute) and flute for merriment, You are seated in the\nVirasana Yoga posture, You are eternal bliss, You are above all, You are the\nGoddess, and You rule the Lords as Rajarajeshvari||3||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chitrubhi\nparadevatha bhagavathi sri rajarajeshwari 4<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">O Bhadrakali! Mother\nAmba, You are frightening Raudrini, You are Bagala, Javalamukhi, Vaisnavi and\nBrahmani, You vanquish the three worlds, You are worshipped by the Devas, You\nare resplendent with light, You are Camunda, You are the mother who adorns,\nprotects and nutures, You are Sati or Daksayani, You are eternal bliss, You are\nabove all, You are the Goddess, and You rule the Lords as Rajarajeshvari||4||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ambha\nkula dhanuhu : kasaangusadhari arthendhu bhimbhaadari<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Varaahi\nmadhu kaidhabha prasamani vaani ramaa sevithaa<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mallaathyaasuraha\nmughadaithya mdani maaheshwari shambhiga<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chitrubhi\nparadevatha bhagavathi sri rajarajeshwari 5<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mother Amba, You are\nwielding a monodent, a goad and a bow, You have a crescent moon on the\nforehead, You are Varahi, You destroyed the demons Madhu and Kaitabh, You are\nhonored by Sarasvati and Lakshmi, You vanquished Malla and Mooka demons, You\nare Mahesvari and Ambika (divine mother), You are eternal bliss, You are above\nall, You are the Goddess, and You rule the Lords as Rajarajeshvari||5||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ambha\nsrishti vinaasa paalanakari aarya visam sobhithaa<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gaayathri\npranvaatcharaamrudharasa: pooranaanu sandhi kridha<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Omkaari\nvinadhasudaarchidapadaa uththanda daithyabhahaa<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chitrubhi\nparadevatha bhagavathi sri rajarajeshwari 6<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mother Amba, You\ncreate, destroy and nurture the world, You are Arya and Gayatri, You are devoid\nof adornment, You are full of the nectar of the &nbsp;pranavakshara &nbsp;OM, You have separated the heaven and the\nearth, You are Omkari, Your feet has been adorned by the son if Vinata\n(Garuda), You destroy the imbecile demons, You are eternal bliss, You are above\nall, You are the Goddess, and You rule the Lords as Rajarajeshvari||6||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ambha\nsaasvadha aagamaadi vinudhaa aarya mahadevathaa<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ya\nbrahmaadi, bibeelikaan janadadhi yaavai jagan mohini<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ya\npanjapranavaadhi repaajanani ya chithkala maalini<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chitrubhi\nparadevatha bhagavathi sri rajarajeshwari 7<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mother Amba, You are\nrevered (bowed) by treatises, You are Arya, and You are the natural forces.\nThat Who gives birth to everyone &nbsp;from\nBrahma and others to the smallest ants, that Who entices the world, that Who\ngives birth to the five types of Pranava syllables (like OM), that Who is the\nart of intellect, You are that One, Who is adorned with a garland. You are\neternal bliss, You are above all, You are the Goddess, and You rule the Lords\nas Rajarajeshvari||7||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ambha\npaalitha bhaktha raaja danisam ambaastagam yaha padeth<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ambha\nlolaa kadatcha veetcha lalithanjaiswarya mavyahadam<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ambha\npavana manthra raaja padana thandesa motcha pradha<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chitrubhi\nparadevatha bhagavathi sri rajarajeshwari 8<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who read these\neight-cantos on Amba (Mother), Which is staying continuously with the devotees\nof Amba, Which is a result of the [bestowing] glance of the eyes of the Mother\nand Which has all the wealth absorbed in it, receive Moksha from the Mother,\nWho is eternal bliss, Who is above all, Who is the Goddess and Who rules the\nLords as Rajarajeshvari, by the means of reading this best among chants.||8||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">__________________<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reverence to Him who\nwears the crescent moon, Him who is embodied in pure consciousness, Him whose\nthree eyes are the three Vedas, and who is the source from which all prosperity\nflows.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">This classical Bharatanatyam\ndance has a mesmerizing effect as it uplifts the dancer and the beholder to a\nhigher level of spiritual consciousness. &nbsp;It is a dancing style that comprises of Bhava,\nRaga, Tala, and Natya which reflect the real meaning of the Bharatnatyam. &nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The pure dance is called nritta and the\nexpressive is nritya. The solo dancer uses various methods of story-telling to\ninterpret the verses and stories she performs. The music is classical and the\nslightest mistake mars the programme.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The person who conducts the recital is\ncalled the natatuvanar,, who is generally the guru of the dancer. He or the\nplays the cymbals called nattuvangam. The other musicians are the vocalist, the\nmridangist or percussion player, of flutist, a violinist and a veena player.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">While\nperforming Bharatanatyam, the artist visualizes her body as made up of\ntriangles like the Sri Yantra . &nbsp;Karanas\nare defined as the 108 key transitional movements of Bharatanatyam. Adavus is\ndefined as a series of steps in Bharatanatyam. The execution of the steps is\ndifferent from style to style. &nbsp;&nbsp;The 108\nprincipals of adavus are recognized by most schools of Bharatanatyam. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The steps of the dance\nare based upon a balanced distribution of body weight and firm positions of the\nlower limbs, allowing the hands to cut into a line, to flow around the body, or\nto take positions that enhance the basic form. &nbsp;Bharatnatyam is known for its grace, purity,\ntenderness and sculpturesque poses .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white Christian invader\ntried every dirty trick to convert Hindus into Christianity.&nbsp; Even an idiot knows that during the Mughal\nrule the classical temple performers faded away.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why did the white\nChristian invader revive the Devadasi myth using their fake mutts and stooge\nacharyas?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole idea was to\nshow temples in bad light. See, the Brahmins would NOT touch a dalit, yet the Brahmin\npriest in a temple would have sex with a dalit prostitute inside the sanctum\nsanctorum, in front of the deity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To be frank, lot of\nHindus became self loathing and it did NOT take too many sops to convert him to\nChristianity. &nbsp;&nbsp;Prasadams of temple\ncreated revulsion and so did the holy theertham. &nbsp;Probably you were given some\ndirty water used to clean the genitals of the priest and the prostitute, after the sexual intercourse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white man created\nthe FAKE Kalidasa . &nbsp;He took pains to\ncreate FAKE works authored by Kalidasa. &nbsp;He\ntook even greater pains pains to praise the works of Kalidasa to the skies\nusing his own media houses and historians. &nbsp;He created the FAKE Radha, the mistress of\nLord Krishna . He created FAKE reference to a Devadasi &nbsp;prostitution system in Kalidasa's\n\"Meghadhoot\". &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It did NOT matter to the\nwhite invader, &nbsp;that NONE of our ancient\nscriptures talk about temple prostitution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white Christian\ninvader created the first anti-Nautch and anti-dedication movement was launched\nin 1882. He creates the disease and now flaunts his vaccines .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">The white ruler made\nsure that he drew his reform lobbyists and social workers from his own stooge\ncommunities, like Parsis, Mahars ( caste of BR Ambedkar ), Chitpavan Jews-nay\u2014Brahmins\n, Tamil dalits ( EVR Periyar followers ) , Christian evangelists etc. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They urged the\nabolition of all ceremonies and procedures by which girls dedicated themselves\nas Devadasis of Hindu shrines. &nbsp;Yet their\npimp agents would initiate, conduct ceremonies and draw attractive virgins and\nkeep them for their own carnal pursuits in their own private whorehouses. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">legal initiatives to outlaw the devadasi\nsystem\u2014one of which was the 1934 Bombay Devadasi Protection Act. Yet British\nsponsored whore houses ran in Grant Road, Farras Road etc.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To be frank , I got\nlot of information from a 90 year old Brit ( nearly 35 years ago ) who told me\nthat he was a 18 year soldier in India during the British Raj\u2014and when I asked\nhim if he was kidding, he told me juicy stories of Grant Road brothels in\nMumbai meant only for the British soldiers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Kamatipura was the OFFICIAL\n\"comfort zone\" for British troops, during British Raj-- created by the\nBritish and maintained by the British.&nbsp; He would\nfrequent , Bachchuseth ki Wadi on Foras Road where there would be young classical\ndancers called Devadasis. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They promised her a\nwell-paid job as a housemaid to help feed her family.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Instead, she ended up\nat one of Asia's largest red light districts to become a sex worker.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Trafficked by her\nneighbour, she arrived at a brothel. &nbsp;She\nwas raped by a customer and spent the next three months in hospital.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">'Harrowing'<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><i><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Guddi's sad and\nharrowing story is similar to many of the estimated 20,000 sex workers in\nKamathipura, established over 150 years ago during colonial rule as one of\nMumbai's \"comfort zones\" for British soldiers.&nbsp;</span></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></span></i></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">( </span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">MADAME HAZEL-- &nbsp;I , CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL BEG TO DIFFER HERE -- THE NUMBER OF DEVADASI &nbsp;PROSTITUTES&nbsp;</span></b></span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">MAINTAINED</span></b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">&nbsp;BY&nbsp;BRITISH WERE MORE THAN 200,000 OR 2 LAKH AT ANY TIME OVER 260 YEARS OF RULE ALL OVER INDIA&nbsp;</span></b><span style=\"color: blue; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">TEMPLE DEVADASI PROSTITUTION WAS CREATED AND SUSTAINED BY THE WHITE CHRISTIAN FOR PLEASURE OF SOLDIERS AND THEN LATER FOR CONVERSION TO CHRISTIANITY PURPOSES AFTER THE GIRLS WERE WRUNG INSIDE OUT AND HUNG OUT TO DRY -&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">VULNERABLE</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;TO PETTY SOPS</span></b><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;)&nbsp;</span></span></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"They raped her to\nbreak her,\" said Ms Thompson.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Ms Thompson's journey\ninto Kamathipura started in 2002 when she travelled there to photograph\nchildren born into the sex trade. The result is her new, interactive ebook,\nTaken.</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Mumbai's oldest and\nlargest red light district is a maze of around 14 dingy, cramped lanes\noverlooked by gleaming, new skyscrapers - symbols of India's recent economic\nprosperity that has lifted millions out of poverty.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">But in Kamathipura,\ntime seems to have stood still.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-LkAySz8WB5Q/UwXsrj5fH4I/AAAAAAAApjE/QY54l6_UTTo/s1600/_70506904_70506902.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-LkAySz8WB5Q/UwXsrj5fH4I/AAAAAAAApjE/QY54l6_UTTo/s1600/_70506904_70506902.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Throughout the 1800s,\nthe British military established and maintained brothels for its troops to use\nacross India.</b></span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">The girls, many in\ntheir early teens from poor, rural Indian families, were recruited and paid\ndirectly by the military, which also set their prices.</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">By 1864, there were\neight neighbourhoods in Mumbai which were home to more than 500 prostitutes.\nAlmost 60 years later, there were only two, with Kamathipura being the largest.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"The system is\ncontinuing to be fed to this day,\" Ms Thompson said.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">To protect the women\nfrom violent customers, police introduced bars to the windows and doors of\nbrothels in the 1890s.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">These \"cages\"\nstill exist today and some women continue to work and live in the same brothels\nconstructed by the British.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Nothing has\nchanged for 120 years. Nothing,\" Ms Thompson claimed.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Today the women charge\nup to 500 rupees ($8; \u00a35) for sex and girls aged between 12 and 16 can earn up\nto 2,000 rupees($32; \u00a320), she added.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Virgins in Kamathipura\nare auctioned to the highest bidder.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-m9gVxxr-vks/UwXui9TkUtI/AAAAAAAApjQ/L31z6PKOOIk/s1600/_70482891_taken_hazel_01.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-m9gVxxr-vks/UwXui9TkUtI/AAAAAAAApjQ/L31z6PKOOIk/s1600/_70482891_taken_hazel_01.jpg\" width=\"298\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">'Modern day slavery'<o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The 35-year-old\nphotographer was able to gain access to this secret world after reaching out to\nBombay Teen Challenge, a charity consisting of former sex workers and pimps who\nfor more than 20 years have been rescuing and rehabilitating women working in\nKamathipura.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Entering the brothels\ninitially under the guise of an aid worker, she shot images discreetly from the\nback of vehicles, the roofs of buildings and under her scarf.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Book cover<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Ms Thompson's ebook\nuses texts, images and videos on life in brothels<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"The way I worked\nwas I would go in and come out. I would spend a few days and attention would\nbuild up so I would leave,\" she said.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">She felt constantly on\nedge every time she went into the district, reaching a tipping point in 2010\nwhen she was manhandled by a gangster while she interacted with a prostitute.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Along the journey\nthere were many times I wanted to give up,\" she added.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Ms Thompson's ebook,\nwhich uses texts, images and videos to get a sense of what life is like in\nKamathipura, also includes stories from women who managed to escape from a\nsituation she describes as \"modern-day slavery\".<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Lata, for example, was\ntricked and trafficked by her boyfriend at the age of 16, when she was drugged\nand taken to Mumbai from the southern state of Karnataka.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">But years later, with\nthe help of Bombay Teen Challenge, she was reunited with her family and now\nlives in a rehabilitation home run by the charity.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"In the 11 years\nI've been there, I've never met one woman who has chosen to be there. Every\nwoman I've met has been trafficked or born there,\" Ms Thompson said.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"These girls who\nhave been trafficked can't return to their families because of the stigma and\n[yet it is] often [they who] are responsible for them being in\nKamathipura,\" she added.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The British\nphotojournalist is also launching a campaign with the UK-based Jubilee Charity\ncalling for India and other countries to criminalise the purchase of sex.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In April, the Indian\ngovernment amended the law to broaden the types of crimes considered to be a\ntrafficking offence and established harsher sentences for traffickers.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">But enforcement of\nanti-trafficking laws remains a problem, as does official complicity, according\nto the US State Department's Trafficking in Persons Report 2013.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Countries like\nSweden and Norway have made the purchase of sexual services illegal and it has\nhad a profound impact on demand, causing trafficking to also decrease\nsignificantly,\" Ms Thompson said.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"This change is\ndesperately needed for Mumbai and all of India.\"<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;(&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-24530198\">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-24530198</a>&nbsp;)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">######################</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The largest and\nbest-known comfort brothels for British soldiers were &nbsp;Sonagachi in Kolkata ( funded by\nDwarakendranath tagore, the grandfather of Rabindranath Tagore ) , Kamathipura in Mumbai, G. B. Road in New\nDelhi, &nbsp;Kashmiri Market in Agra, Silchar Assam , Budhwar Peth in\nPune , Maduahdiah in Varanasi, &nbsp;Naqqasa Bazaar in Saharanpur, &nbsp;Chaturbhuj Sthan\nin Muzaffarpur, &nbsp;Peddapuram and Gudivada in Andhra Pradesh, &nbsp;Meerganj Allahabad Ganga Jamuna Nagpur, Kabadi\nbazar of Meerut etc.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-YhPUG95nm7k/UwZNsbra6WI/AAAAAAAApj4/2cKz3vgPMP0/s1600/lTHHDEarge.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"380\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-YhPUG95nm7k/UwZNsbra6WI/AAAAAAAApj4/2cKz3vgPMP0/s1600/lTHHDEarge.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Almost every hill\nstation has brothels for the British administrators and they loyal Indian stooges.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; color: red; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">To get virgins and pre puberty girls, the ruse of being wedded to Goddess Yellamma was created -- a cock and bull story, injected into various puranas by stooges of British . The British </span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">maintained</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;their own&nbsp;pimp and informer network.<o:p></o:p></span></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; color: red; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-JAfPfgIhihE/UwZPHSfEb-I/AAAAAAAApkE/L7KX57zqxTw/s1600/imaULGges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-JAfPfgIhihE/UwZPHSfEb-I/AAAAAAAApkE/L7KX57zqxTw/s1600/imaULGges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some British officers\ndid NOT want to fornicate with brown girls\u2014as they were hard core racists. For\nthese uppity souls, the Brtiish imported foreign white skinned girls.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When I asked my mother,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The temple was my\nfather!<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Then one day, through\nthe<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The pained surprise in\nmy mother\u2019 eyes,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Devadasis were called Basavis\nin Karnataka State In Karnataka, &nbsp;old\ndevadasis are called as `Jogati' and young devadasis as `Basavi'. &nbsp;The term `Basavi' refers to feminine form of\n`Basava' a bull which roams the village at will without any restriction. &nbsp;Hence `Basavi' alludes to the foot loose\nposition of the woman. &nbsp;In Yellampura\nvillage almost everybody worships Yellamma deity. &nbsp;A dominant caste like Lingayats acknowledge\nYellamma &nbsp;( created by R&nbsp; ) as their family deity. The lingayath\ncommunity was made almost like Christianity with a military style pecking\norder-with Jangams , Settis etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The white invader took full advantage by controlling\ntheir FAKE Lingayat mutts to get petite girls &nbsp;Devadasis ) for FREE SEX in their brothels&nbsp; Devadasis . &nbsp;The R created Khandoba girls were also\nDevadasis <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like how the Karnataka Lingayath\ngirls were devoted to Yellamma , the Maharashtrian girls ( Muralis ) were\ndevoted to Khandoba ( &nbsp;a diety created by\nR ) &nbsp;. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Murali,\nwhose token marriage is performed with the dagger of Khandoba, remains\nunmarried throughout her life and leads a life same as devadasi of Yellama. &nbsp;The girl after her first menses is then\nforbidden to become the wedded wife of any man, and she now has to service the\nwhite man in a whore house . SANSKRIT WORD NAMED \u201cSADBARANI\u201d ( WHORE WHO GIVES SEX FOR MONEY ) IN OUR VEDAS<br />\n<br />\nPOISON was injected into the Vedas that prostitutes must dress in red colour , and even their gold jewellery must painted red to scare away demons and give protection to those who \u201cchose to live in a moral grey zone\u201d<br />\n<br />\nMore than three lakhs ( 380,000 ) white skinned military prostitutes were housed in the Lal Bazaars ( red flesh markets) attached to military cantonments ..<br />\n<br />\nIt was an evening stroll, have free sex with young girls ( age range 12 to 17 ) \u2013 forcing them to degrade themselves with filthy deviant sex.<br />\n<br />\nAll thes girls were given small booklets of HANUMAN CHALISA in Awadhi language , mostly printed by Gita Press Gorakhpur<br />\n<br />\nThe whorehouses for elite British Officers of Rothschid in Calcutta ( Sonagachi) was created by Rabindranath Tagore\u2019s grandfather ( a Pir Ali muslim ) which also contained sections for homosexual pedophilia \u2013 young boys as tender as 8 , for anal sex<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/opium-drug-running-tagore-family-capt.html<br Shiva temple<br />\n<br />\nAccording to a popular FAKE story, sage Jamadagni ordered his son Parshurama to behead his mother Renuka. Parushurama obeyed his father and got three boons in return. He used one of the boons to bring his mother back to life. Renuka\u2019s decapitated head could not be traced. Head of a lower caste woman named Yellamma was attached to Renuka\u2019s body. Thus a lower caste woman achieved the higher status of being a Brahmin\u2019s wife.<br />\n<br />\nFollowing the tradition a number of young girls started dedicating themselves to the FAKE goddess YELLAMMA \u2013and they became prostitutes after first menses<br />\n<br />\nThe white invader injected poison that in Vedic times Devadasis were divided into seven categories.<br />\n<br />\nThey are known as Dutta, Hruta, Bikrita, Bhrutya, Alankara and Gopika or Rudraganika \u2014 depending on the sexual deviancy branch they were experts in oral / anal / morbid fetish etc.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_149b+seedBt2D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_149b+seedBt2D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is the king among\nphysicians,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who cures all great\ndiseases,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like rheumatism and\narthritis,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is saluted by great\nsages,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And to whom, the sun\ngod,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moon and God of fire\nare eyes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Vakchrothra nethrangiri\nviheena jantho,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Vakchrothra nethrangiri\nsukha pradaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Kushtadhi sarvonnatha\nroga hanthre,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sri Vaidyanathaya nama\nsivaya.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I salute that God Shiva,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is the king among\nphysicians,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who blesses those\nbeings,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who have lost their\nspeech, hearing, sight and ability to walk,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With these abilities,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And who provides cure,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For devastating\ndiseases like leprosy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Vedantha vedhyaya jagan\nmayaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Yogiswara dhyeya\nPadambujaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Trimurthy roopaya\nsahasra namne,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sri vaidyanathaya nama\nsivaya.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I salute that God\nShiva,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is the king among\nphysicians,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who can be known\nthrough vedantha,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is spread through\nout the universe,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who has a lotus feet ,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That is meditated upon\nby great sages,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is of the form of\nthe holy trinity,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And who has thousand\nnames.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Swatheertha mrudbasma\nbrudanga bajam,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Pisacha dukha arthi\nbhayapahaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Athma swaroopaya\nsareera bajaam,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sri Vaidyanaathaya\nnamasivaya.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I salute that God\nShiva,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is the king among\nphysicians,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who removes all\nsuferings,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Caused by bad spirits,\nsorrows and fears,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By dip in his holy\ntank,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the holy ash in the\ntemple,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And by the mud below\nthe neem tree of the temple,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And who is the\npersonification of soul,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Occupying human body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sree neelakandaya\nvrushaba dwajaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sarakkanda basmadhya\nabhi shobithaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Suputhradarathi\nsubagyathaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sri vaidyanathaya nama\nsivaya.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I salute that God\nShiva,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is the king among\nphysicians,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who has a blue neck,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who has the the bull on\nhis flag,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who shines by flowers,\nsacred ash and sandal,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who grants good\nchildren and good wife,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And who blesses us with\nall good luck.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Balambikesa vaidyesa\nbava roga haredisa,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Japen nama thrayam\nnithyam maha roga nivaranam.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who recite this\nprayer,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thrice a day with\ndevotion,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And pray the Lord\nVaidyanatha,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is with his consort\nBalambika,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And who removes the\nfear of birth and death,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Would get cured of all\ngreat diseases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_84B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1355131828973993083\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_84M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/08173368436479307173\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Anurag Shukla</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_8.html?showComment=1515577636725#c1355131828973993083\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 10, 2018 at 3:17 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_84MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nFollow your inner voice. When reading bhaja govindam previously, even I did not fee comfortable with the first verse saying \"\u0938\u092e\u094d\u092a\u094d\u0930\u093e\u092a\u094d\u0924\u0947 \u0938\u0928\u094d\u0928\u093f\u0939\u093f\u0924\u0947 \u0915\u093e\u0932\u0947<br />\n\u0928\u0939\u093f \u0928\u0939\u093f \u0930\u0915\u094d\u0937\u0924\u093f \u0921\u0941\u0915\u0943\u0919\u094d\u0915\u0930\u0923\u0947\". Then again the part where a saffron clad Adi Sankara says<br />\n\u091c\u091f\u093f\u0932\u094b \u092e\u0941\u0923\u094d\u0921\u0940 \u0932\u0941\u091e\u094d\u091b\u093f\u0924\u0915\u0947\u0936\u0903<br />\n\u0915\u093e\u0937\u093e\u092f\u093e\u092e\u094d\u092c\u0930\u092c\u0939\u0941\u0915\u0943\u0924\u0935\u0947\u0937\u0903 \u0964<br />\n\u092a\u0936\u094d\u092f\u0928\u094d\u0928\u092a\u093f \u091a \u0928 \u092a\u0936\u094d\u092f\u0924\u093f \u092e\u0942\u0922\u094b<br />\n\u0939\u094d\u092f\u0941\u0926\u0930\u0928\u093f\u092e\u093f\u0924\u094d\u0924\u0902 \u092c\u0939\u0941\u0915\u0943\u0924\u0935\u0947\u0937\u0903 \u0965 \u0967\u096a\u0965<br />\n<br />\nThere are many who go with matted locks, many who have clean<br />\nshaven heads, many whose hairs have been plucked out; some are<br />\nclothed in orange, yet others in various colours --- all just for<br />\na livelihood.<br />\n<br />\nHow can a saint himself deride saints like this? Even if there are black sheep, will he write a verse deriding all sadhus?<br />\n<br />\nAgain in Hanuman Chalisa - even when reading it aloud, I could not get myself to say these lines -<br />\n<br />\n\u0914\u0930 \u0926\u0947\u0935\u0924\u093e \u091a\u093f\u0924\u094d\u0924 \u0928 \u0927\u0930\u0908 \u0964<br />\n\u0939\u0928\u0941\u092e\u0924 \u0938\u0947\u0907 \u0938\u0930\u094d\u092c \u0938\u0941\u0916 \u0915\u0930\u0908 \u0965\u0969\u096b\u0965<br />\n<br />\nI will not keep any other God in my heart, except Hanuman.<br />\nSo I will not even remember Ram/Vishnu (even though Hanuman himself worships Ram)?<br />\n<br />\nThis never felt right.<br />\n<br />\nAs soon as Ajit ji wrote this, it was a Eureka moment.<br />\n<br />\nMany thanks, Ajit ji.</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_84MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_84BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_84B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; SORRY, SHIVA IS A COMIC ALLEGORY<br />\n<br />\nNOW HE GIVES HAJJAR BULL ABOUT HEAVEN, HELL AND CHITRAGUPTA..<br />\n<br />\nSORRY --THERE IS NO HEAVEN AND HELL IN HINDUISM.. WE NEVER HEARD OF CHITRAGUPTA ( AND MISSING LINK KAYASTHAS ) TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA..<br />\n<br />\nIN SANATANA DHARMA HEAVEN IS THE SEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER ( BRAHMAN THE FIELD ) WHO SHEARED OFF A SMALL BIT OF HIS BODY AND SEND YOU AS A SOUL ( BALL OF ENERGY ) AT ITS LOWEST FREQUENCY TO GAIN LIFE EXPERIENCE..<br />\n<br />\nYOU ( YOUR SOUL EVOLVED ) FROM BACTERIA, TO BIRD, TO ANIMAL TO HUMAN WITH LOW FREQUENCY SOULD TO MOKSHA SOUL OF HIGHEST FREQUENCY , SAME AS BRAHMAN --AFTER WHICH YOUR SOUL MERGED BACK WITH MOTHER FIELD OF BRAHMAN TO SHARE LIFE EXPERIENCES WITH ITS MOTHER ..<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE FEED BACK STOPS IN THIS CLOSED LOOP --PRALAYA ( DISSOLUTION ) HAPPENS ..<br />\n<br />\nFIRST ASTRAL LATER IS MEANT FOR ALL SPECIES OF LIVES --EXCEPT HUMAN .. THE SOULS OF CRIMINALS/ HOMOSEXUALS WHO HAVE NO CONSCIENCE ARE IN THE LAYER..<br />\n<br />\nSECOND TO SIXTH LAYERS ARE MEANT ONLY FOR CONSCIOUS HUMANS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER MEANT FOR SOULS WITH LOWEST FREQUENCY ( HIGH NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ) AND THE SIXTH ASTRAL HAVING PARKING SPACE FOR SOULS OF HIGHER FREQUENCY ( LOW NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ).<br />\n<br />\nYAMA IS IN CHARGE OF LAYERS TWO TO SIX..<br />\n<br />\nALL SOULS IN FIRST TO SIXTH ASTRAL LAYERS --AWAIT RE-BIRTH.<br />\n<br />\nSEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER IS THE FIELD OF BRAHMAN ( VAIKUNTA ).. HERE ONLY MOKSHA SOULS -- NIL EGO, NIL KRAMIC BAGGAGE AND HIGHEST SOULD FREQUENCY ( SAME AS MOTHER FIELD BRAHMAN ) CAN ENTER --TO BE MERGED WITH BRAHMAN ( GOD )..<br />\n<br />\nONLY SOULS CAN ENTER ALL SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS --NOT THE PHYSICAL BODY ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE RASCAL SADUGU JAGGI VASUDEV LIES ABOUT PLENTY FOOD TO EAT AND APSARAS FOR SEX IN SEVENTH LAYER .. BALLS !<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE 5 PANDAVA BROTHERS AND DRAUPADI DECIDE TO CLIMB MOUNT MERU --IT IS AN ALLEGORY FOR DEATH AND SOULS PARKING AT ONE OF THE SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS<br />\n<br />\nYAMA ( DHARMA ) IN THE FORM OF A DOG JOINS THIS GROUP ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMA USHERS IN --<br />\nDRAUPADI INTO THE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nNAKULA INTO THE THIRD ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nSAHADEVA INTO THE FOURTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nBHIMA INTO THE FIFTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nARJUNA INTO THE SIXTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\n<br />\nAND THEN YUDHISTRA LOOKS BACK AND SEES THE DOG.. HE KNOWS THAT NO DOG CAN GET PAST THE FIRST ASTRAL LAYER --AND HE IS PUZZLED..<br />\n<br />\nAT THE SEVENT ASTRAL LAYER ( EQUIVALENT OF HEAVEN ) YUDDHISTRA SEES ALL HUNDRED KAURAVAS ALREADY THERE -- ALONG WITH THE STALWARTS LIKE BHISHMA/ DRONA /KARNA ETC<br />\n<br />\nHE IS SHOCKED AND ANGRY<br />\n<br />\nAT THAT TIME YAMA ( THE DOORKEEPER OF ASTRAL LAYERS 2 TO 6 ) DECLARES THAT HE IS YUDDHISTRAs FATHER WITH KUNTI .. AND THAT YUDDHISTRA STILL HAS SEEDS OF EGO WITHIN HIMS WHICH MAKES HIM UNFIT FOR MOKSHA ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMAs EXPLANATION: WHOEVER KRISHNA KILLED --ALL GOT MOKSHA .. KRISHNA HAD THE UNWRITTEN TASK OF KILLING ALL 100 TEST TUBE KAURAVA BABIES-- HE DID IT AND HOW..<br />\n<br />\nPANDAVAS WOULD HAVE HAD ALBINO BLOOD OF MOTHER KUNTI HAS SEX WITH PANDU ( AN ALBINO )--AND IN THAT CASE KRISHNA WOULD HAVE KILLED ALL 5 PANDAVAS TOO..<br />\n<br />\nBeautiful and intelligent Queen Kunti was the mother of Karna and the first three Pandava brothers Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna. .<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_179BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px;
